definition: to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
surname Bao
to complain/to grumble/to harbor a complaint/to feel dissatisfied
to embrace/to hug
to hug/to cherish/within the bosom (of the family)/to embrace (also fig. an ideal, aspiration etc)
to be sorry/to feel apologetic/sorry!
aspiration/ambition
to encircle/surrounded by
to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
to come to the aid of sb suffering an injustice/to fight for justice/also written 抱打不平[bao4 da3 bu4 ping2]
adopt (a child)
to hug/to embrace
to hold (expectations, hopes etc)/to maintain (an attitude etc)/to harbor (doubts etc)/to clinch (boxing)
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
to be ill/to be in bad health
to wrap one's arm around (used to describe the girth of a tree trunk)
to be outraged by an injustice

sentences.english: Dumbledore took Harry in his arms and turned toward the Dursleys' house.
sentences.chinese: 邓布利多把哈利抱在怀里，朝德思礼家走去。

sentences.english: Spin me around til I fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 抱着我旋转直到我睡着。

sentences.english: Jack has rather jaundiced opinions about all these modern ideas.
sentences.chinese: 杰克对所有这些现代观念都抱有相当偏颇的看法。

sentences.english: And Pierre began to have the same feeling towards Karataev.
sentences.chinese: 皮埃尔也开始对卡拉塔耶夫抱着同样的感情。

sentences.english: One of his hands, as I have said, held the umbrella: in the other arm he carried several brown-paper parcels.
sentences.chinese: 他一只手撑着伞，另一只手臂抱着几个棕色的纸包。

sentences.english: So we, with an attitude of pursuing true emotion, seek for love.
sentences.chinese: 于是我们抱着追求真感情的态度，寻找爱情。

sentences.english: The liberals prefer to sit on the fence while the other parties fight it out.
sentences.chinese: 自由党宁可抱骑墙态度，坐待其他党派去斗争到底。

sentences.english: Xue in order to protect the security of LaoZheng, holding the LaoZheng, he had been wounded.
sentences.chinese: 雪儿为了保护老郑的安全，抱着老郑，自己被打伤了。

sentences.english: The door opened and in came a woman with a baby in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 门开了，走进一位妇女，怀里抱着个孩子。

sentences.english: Cossack got off his horse, lifted the boy down, and came with him to Denisov.
sentences.chinese: 那个哥萨克把孩子抱下马，把他带到杰尼索夫跟前。

sentences.english: We rode on a huge horse. Grumdalclitch carried me in my box.
sentences.chinese: 我们骑在大马上，葛兰朵克丽琪则抱着装我的箱子。

sentences.english: Dad really stood up, holding his daughter career.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸真的站起来了，他抱着女儿老泪纵横。

sentences.english: Adema cradles his one year old daughter in his arms, as he stands outside his hut.
sentences.chinese: 阿迪马抱着他一岁的女儿，站在简陋小屋的外边。

sentences.english: Even my always "cool" daddy was almost burst into tears and he gave me a very warm hug.
sentences.chinese: 连一向很“酷”的爸爸也快要哭了，还抱了抱我。

sentences.english: Even my always "cool" daddy was almost burst into tears and he gave me a very warm hug.
sentences.chinese: 连一向很“酷”的爸爸也快要哭了，还抱了抱我。

definition: to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
embrace/bosom
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
to nestle against/to snuggle up to
to hug/to embrace
closely/tightly
to let go of sth/to give up
to carry sb the way grooms carry brides across the threshold
to pinch (with one's fingers)/to knead/to make up
variant of 捏[nie1]
dear one/to kiss/friendly
to grip/to hold
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
thigh
to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help
arm/CL:隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2],雙|双[shuang1]
to relinquish one's grip/to let go
